titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Council for Inter-American Security records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Daniel Case

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-01-27T09:42-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Collection processed and rehoused by Daniel Case.

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, conference papers, memoranda, minutes, press releases, press summaries, and statistics relating to security requirements of various Latin American countries, especially in Central America; guerrilla activity in El Salvador; and a series of World Media Conferences on the media, especially in relation to formulation of American foreign policy. Includes statistics of incidences of violence in El Salvador and papers of Lynn Francis Bouchey, president of the Council.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Council for Inter-American Security records, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1986.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1976 by Ronald Docksai and headed by Lynn Francis Bouchey from 1977 to 1992, the Council for Inter-American Security's (CIS) mission objective was to clarify the common security interests of Western Hemisphere nations, provide strategic advice for the protection of those interests, and disseminate its recommendations. Publications and analyses from CIS focused primarily on Latin American countries and provided data and statistics to Congress, the executive branch, and the American public.

In the early years of the Ronald Reagan administration, the organization was one of the more influential think tanks of the New Right, providing both policy and policymakers to the new administration. CIS also sponsored educational programs, seminars, conferences, and briefing sessions; conducted direct mail and advertising campaigns; and produced publications, radio shows, films, and television documentaries on various issues relating to foreign policy and national defense posture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The materials in the Council for Inter-American Security records, including correspondence, reports, conference papers, memoranda, minutes, press releases, press summaries, and statistics, were collected by Lynn Francis Bouchey during his time as president of the Council for Inter-American Security (CIS) from 1977 until his resignation in 1992. The collection focuses on security for Latin America countries such as El Salvador, Guatemala, Nicaragua, and countries in the Caribbean against Soviet and Communist infiltration and expansion.
The collection has been organized into ten series, and the original folder titles have been retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprised of correspondence, travel records, projects, and notes of Lynn Francis Bouchey, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes records on the sponsorship, production of, and participation in educational programs, seminars, conferences, symposiums, and briefing sessions during the final years of the Cold War. There are subseries on the Center for Liberation Strategy conference in 1986, the Inter-American Symposiums held annually between 1979 and 1981, the Geneva Conference in 1986, and World Media Conferences held consecutively between 1981 and 1983. The conferences cover topics relating to political and economic security between the United States and Latin American nations between 1977 and 1988. The subseries have been arranged alphabetically, then chronologically thereunder.

unittitle.emph: Central America: Myths and Disinformation,

did.unittitle: Convention on National Defense (Leadership Foundation Convention),
Central America and the US Conference,
Central America Freedom Alliance Conference - human rights,
US-Colombian Legislative Conference on Narcotics Laws, Puerto Rico,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notable correspondents include Jean-Louis Clariond, Ambassador Robert H. McBride, Jack Skelly, Ambassador William Middendorf, Frank Calzon, Robert Reilly, and Congressional contacts. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Association of American Chambers of Commerce in Latin America,
Coalition for Free Elections in El Salvador,
Coalition for Democracy in Central America,
Costa Rica Action Plan for Tom Miller,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes files on organizations that worked in conjunction with the CIS, such as the Central American Working Group (CAWG), Organization of American States (OAS), Asamblea Nicaraguense Unidad Democrática, Central American Program of Undergraduate Scholarship (CAMPUS), and Unión del Centro Democrático.

did.unittitle: Q and A on El Salvador,
National Council of World Affairs Organizations,
Central American Program of Undergraduate Scholarships,
The Caribbean and Latin American Scholarship Program,
"The Transition to Democracy in Central America,"
"The Role of the Military in the Transition of Democracy," Spain,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials related to a video on North.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes statistical reports of acts of violence between 1979 and 1984 relating to guerilla activity during the civil war in El Salvador. Additional reports relating to agro-industrial development and cold war political-economic relations are also included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets collected while traveling between conferences in Latin America and Europe relating to the socio-political atmosphere of the 1980s between the Western and Eastern hemispheres. Arranged chronologically.
